website_summaries.verdict: With its budget-friendly price, a wide range of color options, and exceptional comfort, it is no doubt that numerous purchasers consider the Saucony Jazz Low Pro a great investment.Oozing with a retro and fashionable look that caters to all ages and a wide range of fashion taste, the majority of actual wearers were well pleased with its overall performance, especially in terms of comfort and style, in such a way that they desire to get more pairs in different colors.
pros: The Saucony Jazz Low Pro lays out a wide range of options in terms of shoe color
The price of this shoe is inexpensive
Many of those who have worn this shoe highly commended it for the utmost comfort it delivers
The Jazz Low Pro is true to size, according to a huge number of purchasers
Many purchasers commented that not only does this shoe is extremely comfortable, it also is great looking and very stylish
Some of the actual wearers appreciated that the shoe is light in weight
It is lighter than the original Jazz model
Many of the reviewers were well-pleased with their pairs such that they will order another one in a different color
The shoe does not require any break in period, as stated by some of the actual wearers
Many of the reviews said that the shoe is a great everyday shoe
cons: A small number of purchasers were disappointed that the pairs they recently bought seem to fall apart easily, some only a few weeks from purchase
some with blemishes, smudge marks, or excess glue on the shoe
Several reviewers noted that the shoe fits narrow, especially in the toe box area
Some of the reviewers commented that the arch support of this shoe is minimal
The insole seems to not offer much cushioning as compared to the other Saucony Jazz Pro previously purchased, as mentioned by one purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Best sneakers ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair of this style/color, but after getting my first pair Dec 2016, I bought 4 more from saucony in different colors. These are so light and breathe well. My current pair isn't even in bad shape, I just wear them to work so I need cleaner looking shoes for my office. I used to wear Onitsuka Tiger Colorados, but these are the same exact style and half the price. Also, they last longer and are more comfortable to wear. If they maintain their current quality, they have a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They look really good, the colors and materials
customer_reviews.text: I have changed New Balance for Saucony. They look really good, the colors and materials, and a little bit more wide, not to narrow. I would like people share more info about sizes the shoes they wear. I am 10.5 in Nike, Adidas, new balance and saucony are the same, 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: M. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Husband approved
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these! He is a chef, and he was sick of expensive "kitchen shoes" that ended up killing his feet after a day's work. These are light, well fitting, have decent arch support (not the greatest, but good for the price), and wipe clean super easily. He ordered his regular size, and at first he was worried they were too snug. But after wearing them once, they loosened up abbot and fit him perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, stability, and easy on the wallet!
customer_reviews.text: Was in need of some affordable sneakers and all the stores were closing, figured I’d give these a go. They are comfortable with good grip. I can’t actually feel the surface below my foot but feel supported. Using memory foam and similar shoes negatively impacted my feet and balance so I’m glad to have found these. A little more room in the toe area since they are men’s and I appreciate that. I normally wear a women’s size 9 and this fit perfect. Dig the retro look too.
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Fashion forward... to the past
customer_reviews.text: Putting these on was literally like stepping back into 1981. These feel precisely the same as the Pumas and Nikes I used to wear in the early 80's- the lightweight construction, thinly padded nylon fabric, shallow foam sole ( I can feel the treads on the sole through the bottom of the shoe)...But for my tastes, these shoes can stay in 1981. I am a big guy with really wide feet and these look ridiculous on me- like a pair of slippers. I do like the way they look out of the box and they were surprisingly accommodating for a wide foot, so giving them 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wohlslagel

customer_reviews.title: Less Than Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I do not like to post a negative review. But I have to say, these shoes were a disappointment. They body of the shoe is very small. It looks like I am wearing a child's shoe. The padding in the sole is non-existent. The shoe feels like wearing a moccasin rather than a shoe with a sole. The appearance in the photo is accurate but not too scale.They appear to be well made, I regret the purchase and will like donate the shoes to the goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bubba

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking retro sneakers that are very affordable. That being said, I wouldn’t buy another pair. They are cheaply made, you can tell just by the feel of the materials. Also they run small. I bought a size up based on other reviewers comments and they are still snug at the toe. Some reviewers use them for running...to each their own...and maybe I ordered a different version, but I can’t see these holding up to distance running. They are just fashion sneakers. If you are into running I recommend spend the extra money on a dedicated running shoe built for your running style. If you just want some cool looking lightweight fashion sneakers that don’t cost much, then consider these!
customer_reviews.author: p-bass5

customer_reviews.title: Perfect casual shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide, flat feet, so I approach every pair of new shoes like a hungry lion (very carefully.) That said, these shoes are amazing - they have a neutral footbed that is wide enough and super cushy, which is extremely rare. They are very durable and go with just about everything, so while I have a a few dozen pairs of shoes I come back to these all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Check for size defects
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with a defect. Ordered a siE 10. Size on tongue said US10. Size on sole said 9.5. They fit like a 9.5. Very sad I had to sent these back. Not sure if it was a one-off error or a whole batch were bad but keep an eye out for this if you have issues. Return via kohl’s drop off was a new experience. Line was long but I basically had to do nothing and I somehow got my refund within a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: mashedpotatoes

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the city shoe I was looking for..
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are nice. Unfortunately I live in Boston where it rains or snows a fair amount, and I do a lot of walking, several miles a day. I was hoping these Saucony shoes would be a little thicker, more water resistant, I dunno. Don't get me wrong, I wore them the other day and they held up just as good as any of my other Saucony shoes. I'll just need to wait for nice weather to wear them. Also they seem much lighter grey than the photos show.
customer_reviews.author: Adkison

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kicks
customer_reviews.text: I use to wear Saucony all the time in High School and loved them. I do not remember why I stopped wearing them but these new ones brought back memories for sure. Very lightweight and comfortable. Grip on the bottom is awesome for all around use and rugged. Highly recommend and will be picking up other colorways.
customer_reviews.author: Animefu

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but they are slightly smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice retro shoe but is a bit smaller than my retro new balance in the same size still wearable but could use a bit more room for every day use. Update I was looking at my shoes and I think I found the problem the soles have 11.5 on them but the tag has12 on it I believe these are actually 11.5 size that is why they fit tight. see pics
customer_reviews.author: A. Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but they run small.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony Jazz for many years and have had many pairs. I ordered these Low Pro versions, same size (11), and tried them on for a moment, then took them off and threw the box out. I then wore them for an extended period later and found them too tight by about half a size. I then directly compared them to another pair of regular Jazz shoes I have and they are indeed tighter. I'm now going to have to donate these or sell them second hand. Rather disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - been wearing this brand for 15 years
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable from the day you put them on. There's not really any "break-in", they are just instantly comfortable. I really enjoy the style too, they are very attractive. I have probably 6 different pairs of the jazz low pro and I like rotating them out. The price for these is also always a good deal, from 40 to 60 dollars is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Chase from San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice with two color shoelaces.  But too tight.
customer_reviews.text: I buy 11 size. This one fits like a 10.5 for me. The whole shoe by itself looks pretty small as well. I just bought another shoe from amazon, size 11 and that fits perfectly. But this shoe will last much longer, I can tell. Love the fact that it came with two color shoelaces. I'm excited to order the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Krishna

customer_reviews.title: Nice style but too narrow for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of old school sneakers but many of them are just not a good fit for my foot type (thick, short, kind of flat...think hobbit minus the hair). I read reviews saying this shoe ran wide. Not wide enough for me I guess. Length was good a half size up from my usual, but toe box was (predictably) too tight. Guess I’ll stick with my usual ASICS. Worth a try, these certainly look cool.
customer_reviews.author: ZenguyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Shoes were used/returned item
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look nice, and I hope they fit the person I bought them for. However, they were a returned item, because there was debris on the bottom of the shoes, AND SOMEONE ELSE'S PET'S HAIR ALL INSIDE BOTH SHOES. I'm assuming this doesn't happen often, but it was really off-putting and yuck.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine McMillan

customer_reviews.title: They make my feet sweat profusely! Not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: When my shoes arrived the colors were different than what was pictured, but I don’t mind, they aren’t nearly as dark as the ones pictured. But the thing is, these things make my feet sweat like crazy! It’s gross! I’ve never really experienced this. It was freezing today and my feet were swampy. I may have to cut vent holes. I find then pretty uncomfortsble as well, there’s no cushion to the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great colors, fit, light & low priced shoes
customer_reviews.text: This was the fifth pair of low pros I’ve bought. The variety of colors is great, they’re usually pretty cheap, look & feel perfect. I wear size 11 or 11&1/2 shoe but I get these in 11&1/2. They’re very light & have replaced what was my favorite shoes, New Balance 574s.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!!! I have slightly wide feet. I really like the basically flat sole and the somewhat "minimalist" feel. Very comfortable, very light, classic style, and priced great. I've bought several pairs of these shoes... I hope Saucony never stops making them.
customer_reviews.author: James Munchbach

customer_reviews.title: I don’t buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable, useful shoes I have found; I am on my third pair because of how long they last and universal they are. The rubber cleats provide excellent traction when climbing trails or mountains, or for just about anything (except running on a wet sidewalk). I don’t buy anything else anymore for active shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Noor

customer_reviews.title: great trainers
customer_reviews.text: Saucony makes a great product, and I'm fortunate they continue this line: having a heel-lift requirement for leg-length difference, these make the cobbler's job easy to fill the prescription...big shout-out to Bruce at Wayland Shoe Repair in Providence!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Dunn

customer_reviews.title: felt great while wearing
customer_reviews.text: This was my third pair of these shoes and, as always, felt great while wearing. However after a few weeks I noticed a pain on my left foot almost as if I'd twisted my ankle. I ignored it for a few weeks but the pain was consistent. Eventually i checked with my doctor and he suggested it could be the shoes. I switched to another pair of shoes and the pain disappeared within a week. Feels like it was an arch support issue from the shoe, which obviously will be different for every person. I'd never had this problem with other Jazz Low Pro's so not sure if they made design changes or it was this specific pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these shoes. Not because they wear out fast but it's hard to beat comfortable,nice looking shoes at this price. I still wear my first pair everywhere daily and I've had them well over a year.The only wear is on the inside lining which is minimal especially as active as I've been in them.Just a great comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: JSB12

customer_reviews.title: Will be lawn mowing shoes right away.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is not very comfortable. Other retro Saucony, that I have, are better. Runs small for me. Will relegate to lawn mowing duties out the box. I usually don't do that until I've had sneakers for a while.
customer_reviews.author: rgv caster

customer_reviews.title: Great simple shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 3 pairs of the lowpros and they don’t disappoint. I like the retro look and it was no problem adding a more supportive insole. My only complaint would be that the sole is very sticky and makes noise when you walk on linoleum or hardwood floors. Would be great if they came out with some more colors as well.
customer_reviews.author: SchlitzeTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe - comfortable with so many cool color combos.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several pairs of the Men's Jazz Low Pro and I really like this shoe. The classic Saucony sneakers are sharp looking, but in my opinion, they don't provide anywhere near the support the Jazz Low Pro offers. Shoe is perfectly snug and there are a ton of really good looking color combinations for this style offered by Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Brophinator

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes. I keep reordering.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about these shoes. I continue to order them over and over again. Super comfortable, lightweight, and they can be dressed up or down pretty easily. I've even worn them during trade shows for work, and they hold up well providing all-day comfort. Although they're more of a casual shoe and not an athletic shoe, I have an extra pair that I use at the gym which works well, largely because they've got great, grippy soles and are really lightweight. I highly recommend these and all Saucony shoes for their great fit, comfort, and overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: wayfarer05

customer_reviews.title: narrow, almost no arch support
customer_reviews.text: this shoes looks better on picture than in real life. in reality they looks cheaply made. quite narrow and long. you may want to go 1/2 size up but since they are already long - it may not work. also almost no arch support (fortunately insoles are removable)
customer_reviews.author: Mnemonic

customer_reviews.title: looks good and super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because wearing my gym shoes for long days on my feet just was not fashionable. These shoes look great while being very comfortable to wear all day on my feet. They are super lightweight. The nylon is very thin and not very water resistant, but then again what nylon shoe is. For reference my gym shoes are Nike Free 5.0 and Flyknit 4.0. If those shoes are 10 out of 10 for comfort and support, I give these 9 out of 10. I cannot comment on durability, but I am going on vacation soon so we will see how they stand up to probably 100 miles of walking in the next month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Beaten up after three months
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Jazz as my go-to cheap walking around shoe for the last ten years or so, and I have never had a pair that has shown so much wear after so brief a time. The soles are wearing down--FAST--and the structure around the foot opening is flimsy. My heel collapses the back of the shoe each time I put one on, and I have to spend the next few minutes digging out. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but quality is kinda mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes but quality is kinda mediocre. I don’t expect anything less for the price. To be honest, the shoes had “too low” of a profile for my liking, but they’re still comfortable. I use them as mowing shoes, as I was expecting a bit different height of the shoe according to the picture. Nonetheless, it’s a great shoe for the price and comfortable. Not my style to wear on a daily basis. Expected the styling to be a bit higher at the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Classic shoes with great tread, but in need of additional support
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Saucony's classic lifestyle shoes. The Jazz Low Pro has been around so long for a reason... and I think that reason is the sole. The traction on these shoes is unparalleled in this strata of the shoe world. There is a Jeep-tire-like sound when the shoes move on pavement. The chunky tread does not, however, detract from the slim profile of the shoe. With jeans, these have become a weekend staple. I should caution, however, that the internal support is almost non-existent. I would highly recommend obtaining a comfortable insert for a few dollars in order to make these classic kicks a little more wearable.
customer_reviews.author: Simple

customer_reviews.title: Nice cape, quality materials and workmanship, cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable sneakers. Only wore them a couple of times for short times, however, they seem to be made of high quality materials and workmanship. Nice color combo. Would definitely buy again. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: John, Dunedin, Fla

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good, very comfortable right out of the box. Very light-weight (surprisingly so) . Good looking and I feel that I can wear them anywhere that a casual dress code would allow. Quite pleased with this purchase. I'll monitor for durability and update if anything less than expected happens in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of shoes. They even give you a extra pair of shoe strings in red. I just got them so dont kno how long they will last. They feel light wieght made of cheep material. So i will keep all you buyers posted
customer_reviews.author: Knice30

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual wear.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable running shoe that is probably better for casual wear than running. If you're a runner, get something more substantial. Still, very good shoe and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Simple cool shoe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice shoe for the price. Nothing spectacular but I think they’re simple, classic and cool. They showed up a little puffy and along the top especially on the lower tongue and above the toes. The more I wear them the it forms to my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique13

customer_reviews.title: Collect them all!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of low pros in general. This is probably my 30th pair. Comfortable, classic style, tons of colors, durable and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Soles should last, Colors a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these from New Balance 574's and 373's due to price and (the hope) that the soles would last longer than one year of regular use (unlike the classic New Balance's). The construction seems solid. Be warned that the colors are a little off on some of these. I ordered the blue/grey pair, and they were more like navy than royal blue. The red/grey pair I ended up with are really a dark orange, similar to the University of Texas colors. I'm fine with that, but they're not actually red.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. DM Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is my favorite brand of running shoes. I use this specific pair for more of a fashion shoe. They are not as comfy as their running shoes but plenty comfy for a shoe under 50 bucks. I think they are super stylish and look great with both shorts and nice jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cazzuto

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive way to get into a retro style runner.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice light shoes, and very comfortable for all day. The tread pattern is a bit chunky, and you can feel it when you walk on solid surfaces like tile. They're a great inexpensive way to get into a retro runner style shoe. When I say these "fit as expected", I read the fitment guide that says these run about a half size small. As I'm a 12.5-wide and most shoemakers don't do half-sizes bigger than a 12, this in a 13 fit my foot perfect. For some reason they came out of the box not laced through the last set of eyelets.
customer_reviews.author: Josh J Davies

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe while looking for a comfortable shoe for bartending. I've tried a number of different shoes before this one, and I've got to say it isn't bad, but I've had better. I guess I'll continue my quest for the best shoe for bartending.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: White is Meh
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony Jazz Low Pro shoes. I love the style and the fit and comfort of them. Somehow I do not like these white ones at all. This is one of two colors of these shoes that I bought that I cannot wear because I do not like how it looks (the other being the red ones). Maybe I'll change my mind next summer.
customer_reviews.author: thethirdheat

customer_reviews.title: Go half size larger in this model.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 3 pairs of very similar Saucony running shoes for mostly walking in past year all in same size US 9 mediums. This particular style in 9 is smaller than my other 3 pairs. Unfortunately, i wore them once so I am unable to return.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great casual shoe for those who spend a lot of time walking. They are simple and comfortable. The only reason I put 'no' on the arch support is that they are simple. If you don't need special insoles or have foot issues, then this shoe should fit great, feel great, and work great. The first day I wore them, I wore them for probably 10 hours with no issues. That being said... I probably wouldn't use these for the gym or training. They are a good casual comfortable shoe, but I have no idea how they would do with the stresses of a strenuous work out.
customer_reviews.author: TXEnvGeo04

customer_reviews.title: Good but weak in places
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this 3.5 to 4 for comfort and fit. Very light. Wore them in England when it had been raining. Insides got wet easily. Material in front of the toecap started to wear through after a year. Soul inlays and ankle supports are flimsy and will wear down quick. Other than that i really would not have a complaint. I paid 35 when they were onsale Comfortable and flexible but need reinforcing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable and Great Color Selection
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet, and these shoes fit beautifully - they are snug and support my foot without squishing and hurting my feet. Most shoes I have to wear a few times to stretch them out to make them stop hurting (and some are too uncomfortable and I never get past the first wear or two!) but these shoes are flexible enough and have enough padding for comfort that they felt great right out of the box. That NEVER happens for me when I buy shoes. The selection of colors is great (I have the green and the orange) and they are well constructed. And excellent shoe for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Will not buy from this company again. Shoe color is NOT true to picture and I had to pay to repackage to return!
customer_reviews.author: MGGGK9

customer_reviews.title: Just a great pair of shoes....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought the Saucony trail runners for many years and decided to get these as everyday shoes. They were a perfect fit and I will definitely buy another pair when these get tired.
customer_reviews.author: K. Monaco

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable, I ordered the size I normally wear and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for about 3 weeks. They are very comfortable, I ordered the size I normally wear and it was the right size. Not like Nike, those are 1/2 to a full size to small. I'll never buy them again, unless I can try them on first. I'll buy another pair of these when they start to wear out. I just bought a second pair of these. They fit well right out of the box, I'll keep getting these until the company does something that screws them up. Just like Nike did....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I literally tried on over 100 pairs of shoes at Kohls, Dicks Sporting Goods , Target, and Walmart. I don't know what changed in the last 2 years since I bought running shoes but all the new styles are terrible and don't fit...I tried this retro trainer on a whim and it's amazing! I've gone for a 3 mile walk and have ran 2 miles twice now. Who knew a shoe designed in 1981 would be better than anything made in 2020+!
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy classics!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy classic Saucony low jazz running shoes. Price was a really good deal. They were half the cost of classic New Balance and much more comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Looks great with a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They fit great and they look good too. I have a narrow foot, so I can't tell you if they are tight. I have never put a pair of shoes and thought they were too narrow. I will probally buy another pair of a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: They run small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 10.5s, ended up exchanging for 11s. Both too small. Never worn anything larger than 11. Oh well. They look cool at least
customer_reviews.author: cait

customer_reviews.title: Not the same shoes I purchased a couple years ago, terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these shoes in the past and they have always been great. This latest pair is much cheaper materials. The soles are uneven and have lumps that hurt when you walk. Maybe I just got a bad pair or maybe they just are not up to the quality they used to be. After returning 2 pairs in a row I'm looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Kepsel

customer_reviews.title: Jazz-Designed for comfort and still too cool
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, can’t go wrong with Saucony Jazz.... sometimes I feel like I should just buy every color combination and I’d be set for every outfit. Extremely comfortable all day shoes for every day walking I am wired to the office sometimes when it’s not casual Friday
customer_reviews.author: FunkeeChild AKA Jose Mateos

customer_reviews.title: Runs Very Small/Poor Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony for over two decades and these ran at least one full size small and were of poor build quality. I recommend against this shoe for those reasons.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: Great For Fashion or Fitness!
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying shoes. I hate spending money on shoes. I'm glad I spent money on these shoes! These are super cozy, retro running sneakers that are both fashionable and comfortable. When I purchased them they were on sale (roughly $30, I think) so I would probably not pay full price, but I would definitely buy them again. Pros: -Style and comfort -Wear them all day with no discomfort -Stitching and soles are holding up. Cons: -Maybe slightly small...Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: RCJR

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a totally different fit than the Saucony Men's Shadow Original Sneaker. The shoe is very tight and very uncomfortable if you have anything other than a narrow foot.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pulaski

customer_reviews.title: Feel amazing. Price is amazing. Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: I ABSOLUTELY love these sneakers. They will feel so amazing on your feet. I have flat feet so its often difficult to find sneakers that gives me a pleasant feeling while walking. This shoes does it. I work from 6am to 6pm and these shoe feels like a breeze on my feet. No pain on my toes. Just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cinquain

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Super comfortable. I got these to wear at work (equatorial hot, dry, dusty) and my feet feel pretty good after a long day of being on my feet. Will buy again when I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: TRM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes! I'm wearing them today...like 6 months after purchasing them. They did split the first week I got them, just a little 1/2 inch or so on the inside front. Not sure why, it seemed to just split from normal wear. Nothing else has happened since other than normal usage. They are very very comfy and I love the style. The shoe guy at the mall asked if I liked them because he wants to start carrying them at his store in the mall. Hopefully he does, but I'll probably still buy them here because they'll be 20-30 bucks cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Theraputic and Healing Abilities! More Comfort than Nike!
customer_reviews.text: What most people don't know is that these shoes are very theraputic, similar to walking in a pair of shoes with Dr. Scholl's in them. Next to the comfort of Rockport, these are the only sneakers that I can wear that will heal my gouts or foot troubles. I highly recommend these shoes to any one who have problems or pain with their feet. A+! I will be buying more of these! (I originally had a pair of moss green/yellow ones that are discontinued). Update: I bought a pair of NIKE FREE 5.0 running shoes and they don't stack up to these one bit! I'd rather wear these, and I don't even want to wear the nike's at all...
customer_reviews.author: DresNightfire

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of shoe. It is one of the few that fit my feet well. The only small disappointment is that the tread is very angular and some of it broke off after a few weeks of moderate walking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Manko

customer_reviews.title: Good for hiking
customer_reviews.text: The knob tread is great for hiking/trails, but I have found myself tripping as the tread adds quite a bit of hight compared to normal trainers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are excellent
customer_reviews.text: The fit was great. The shoe itself is wicked light and airy. I would say that if you're going to wear these and expect to walk 5 miles, you might start to feel some aches and pains but to be honest, they are super comfy and stylish. And for such a low price, you really can't go wrong. They also come with an extra pair of laces in orange. Perfect for fall / halloween colors. Seems like my arsenal of Saucony shoes are growing every 3 months. These are great. Now if only there's a red pair
customer_reviews.author: Ol' John boy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap-feeling
customer_reviews.text: The nylon or rylon or whatever this material is makes up the majority of the shoe. It looks wrinkly and feels cheap. The whole shoe feels pretty much like foam. The sole is wearing very unevenly and I can already tell that the shoes aren't going to make it much longer with just normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mix of quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I personally think these are just fabulous shoes. They fit well, they're very comfortable, they're great for just walking around the home or office in, and to boot, they are very reasonably priced for what you get. Why pay $80 for a pay of sneakers when you can pay $50 or less? Plus, they come in a wide variety of colors, generally include two different colored shoelaces, and you pretty much always know what you're going to get.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit-sturdy and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: As always-best shoes for comfort and style. These fit my partner perfectly and he wears the all the time. They have easily removable insoles, so if you have your own-it’s super simple to replace the given with your personal insoles. They are sturdy and lightweight which is perfect for shift work where you are on your feet!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look great, are really comfortable and have hd up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sladaritz

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They look nice enough to wear at work, and they're comfortable enough for me to be on my feet all day. The shoes ran a little narrow, but they feel good after about a week of breaking them in. I'm probably not the best judge of arch support since my arches are fine, but the arches seem fine. The tread on these shoes also makes them nice for trails as well. These are now my go to shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Jtinker

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable and really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are my 2nd pair of Saucony Jazz Low Pro shoes. After 9 years I decided to retire the old pair for lawn duty only. The new pair fits great and they really look wonderful with most styles of clothing. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: nate archibald

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are now running smaller
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing a size 10 Saucony for YEARS. Why all of a sudden do they fit way too tight? Even put one on with an older size 10 I already owned, also Saucony, and this new one was definitely shorter and tighter across the top.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lawson

customer_reviews.title: They run very big
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a 10.5 for years. I ordered a 10.5 and a 10, just in case. The 10.5 was so big i didn't even try it on. they were huge. even the 10's were too big. returned them both even though i liked the look of the shoes a lot
customer_reviews.author: JayDee

customer_reviews.title: Looked good in the photo but not my style in real life
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit on the tight side at my usual size. I would have gone up a half size for a perfect fit. I've owned Saucony running shoes and love them, both the look and the fee. I wasn't expecting these to be running shoes but I was hoping for a similar fit and feel and it's just not there. I'll wear these and I imagine the sizing will feel better after they are fully broken in. I'm still on the look out for my next casual sneakers and these Saucony Jazz will be a backup, less frequently worn.
customer_reviews.author: Boby F.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive kicks
customer_reviews.text: This pair is the first for me not to fit perfect. All size 10 have fit me perfect over the years. These are a tad tight and hurt my feet. Can’t seem to break them in enough to be comfortable. Scares me for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Hook

customer_reviews.title: comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: returned the item due to the fact that it ran small. i wear a size 11 on most shoes but this was too small. ill try the 11 1/2 next.
customer_reviews.author: mon

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes brand with great price
customer_reviews.text: I just love Saucony shoes. They are soft and comfortable as no other brand. I use them mostly for work as I stand all day long and they go great with my scrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Tanik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves these shoes. Says they are very comfortable. True to size and feel broke in right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Stephjo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent everyday casual shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony Originals Men's Low Pro Sneaker is an affordable, stylish-retro, everyday casual shoe comparable to New Balance Classics and more comfortable than Asics Onitsuka Tigers Ultimate 81s. The Dark Grey pictured is slightly bluish and lighter when in person, but no less attractive. Be mindful though that the suede leather can easily tear and the nylon can fray, however if taken care of these shoes will last you a good while tread-wise and they are so affordable that you can buy 2 pairs for the price of one New Balance or Asics!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy all arounder
customer_reviews.text: These are some of my favorite all around sneakers. In solid colors I can wear them to work. They are great for walking around town as well and I've even run in them at times when I forgot my running shoes. Will keep buying these when the old ones wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: saucony are the best!
customer_reviews.text: i have 4 pairs of sneakers - ALL saucony! 1) they have 'cool' colors. (very cool shades of the color, to be specific) 2) they are simple/stylish. (opposite to loud, garish and tacky) 3) they fit my wide feet. (without making them look 'big and wide') 4) they are very comfortable. (i don't run in them). i always get the men's - because they seem to have the 'cooler' colors. love, love, love, saucony! please stay cool! :)
customer_reviews.author: yutmom

customer_reviews.title: Love the look
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes 👟 but the stitching in the touch came unstitched where you lace it. No real biggie because it really does not effect anything but still a little uncool for a brand new shoe out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: The fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'm always hesitant about ordering anything to wear on the Internet from a far east country such as Korea. I'll give credit where credit is do -- the quality is what I would expect and the fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: T Frasier

customer_reviews.title: Consistently awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just right all the time. Fashion and comfort. I love the look and feel. Been buying Sauconys for years. Great value
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Great Shows. Lightweight and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design style of these shoes and have now purchased 4 pairs of these. The are very comfortable and lightweight. I can wear them all day in comfort. However, I typically don't wear them multiple days in a row. There is inadequate arch support, so my feet do tend to start hurting after a couple of days. But I typically rotate shoes daily anyway. These are really nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, not the longest lasting.
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd pair of Jazz. They are very comfortable but do wear out quickly. Update. Wear out very quickly. Starting to squeek every step (both shoes) and worn through the inside lining after less than a month of causal wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size tag
customer_reviews.text: Usually order these and love them. However, with my usual 8.5 size lable, but was clearly not a size 8.5. More like a 10. I love these shoes when they're the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Good looking show
customer_reviews.text: Good looking show. Plus, it's a Saucony, so they can be worn all day with no problem. I'm either 11 1/2 or 12. I wear 12 in Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: William Dukes

customer_reviews.title: Good and Cheap Functional Fashion
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They’re cheap and comfortable. The grip is great and they’re pretty durable. I go through a pair every few months.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wynacht

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and quality, half size smaler
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking, for me it is half size smaller. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Slow reader

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Well Made Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I know what to expect when I purchase Saucony. A pair of these will last about a year with moderate use, and even afterwards will continue to function, although they may be a bit worn out. These comfortable walking sneakers will also make a good pair of exercise or sport shoes in a pinch, but they are meant for casual walking and great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Heby

customer_reviews.title: Do not wipe
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of wiping the side of my shoe on the day I bought them because there was a residual glue stain apparently from manufacturing that didn't look too bad, but I wanted the shoes to look perfect. My wet paper towel came back bright yellow and the spot I wiped was now gray. Amazon was wonderful with the return process and I had another pair of shoes very quickly. I just don't wipe them at all now. The shoes are bright and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy classic running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Saucony's got it going as far as classic runners go. Comfortable, with a wide color range. However, they are mass produced in China so I wasn't too surprised to see open seams on the tongue, miss sewn panels on the heels, and glue spilling over the soles. There are worse shoes made for the same price though. I sprayed them with Kiwi Camp Dry water repellant as soon as I pulled them out of the box. Winter is here and they still look great.
customer_reviews.author: m. harrison

customer_reviews.title: A lil snug but still great
customer_reviews.text: I should've just returned em. I'm anywhere between a 10.5-11 men's. The Saucony cohesion's I bought we're 11's, so I got an 11, but needed to do either a 11.5 or 11W in hindsight. Still comfy just a lil snug.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Disque

customer_reviews.title: where have these been all my life
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love these shoes! I bought the gray and vintage orange pair, great look. Shoes have a lot of style, are lightweight and very comfortable. They fit true to size and are well made with nice materials. Consider me a fan for life. Watch out for the dk brown/blue ones though, they look great in the pics but are actually a very dark almost charcoal black brown, so if you were expecting brown, think again.
customer_reviews.author: JPowellCreative

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Got this color because it was least expensive. Only negative is my crazy big toes eventually tore holes through the top just like all the shoes I get. Quality brand for me. Check color and style and you'll likely get these at a great deal too. Right fit, proper arch support despite me have a relatively high arch. BOOYAH!
customer_reviews.author: Maros

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have used at Y for months, mostly on treadmill. Sauconys deserve their reputation as comfortable walking shoes
customer_reviews.author: snowcountrydogs

customer_reviews.title: They don't provide excellent arch support
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoes, just make sure to buy when they're cheap and buy a size or two up since they are narrow and do not come in wide sizes. They don't provide excellent arch support, so I wouldn't recommend running in them. Amazon has an excellent shoe sizer now, definitely the best out there for online stores so it made buying these so much easier. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Jazz Low Pro Cross Trainers
feature_bullets: A thin nylon and suede upper;
Lace-up front, padded collar and tongue;
